title: Comparative Analysis of Team Learning Approaches: Practical Applications in Science

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental Scientific Problem-Solving Skills and Team Project Experience
context.additional_context: Science-focused vocational training course conducted in limited-technology (smartphone-centric) environments, combining twice-weekly face-to-face sessions with asynchronous online activities

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish and explain three or more core characteristics of action learning, problem-based learning (PBL), and project-based learning (PjBL).
Learners can select team learning approaches applicable to science-related tasks based on real-world cases.
Learners can analyze and evaluate interaction elements in learning processes using an activity theory framework.
Learners can perform team projects using smartphone-based collaboration tools in blended learning environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
